profile_positions.description:
Key Accomplishments:
-Handling of Change Management (CR: Change Request/Change Control Request and CO: Change Order) and Periodic Reviews.
-Collected quality data from Quality Systems Metric Results (QSMR) Dashboard and coordinated the QSMR/DRB Slide Deck.
-Scheduled and conducted Quality Systems Management Review (QSMR)/Data Review Board (DRB) Meetings as Facilitator.
-Writing QSMR/DRB Meeting Minutes and closing the Data Review (DR) Record in the EtQ system with the approved Meeting Minutes and the relevant evidence.
-Followed up on the Data Review Actions (DRA) generated from the QSMR/BRD Meeting.
-Prepared and reviewed Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs)/Work Instructions (E-Systems: Agile and TruVault).
-Gap Assessment in site procedures/work instructions with respect to Johnson and Johnson Global Quality Standards.
-Supported Internal (ERC: Enterprise Resource Compliance/Quarterly Audits) and External (DEKRA-US-FDA) Quality Audits.
-Investigated Internal and External Audits Observations, and CAPAs; and documented them in the EtQ system.
-Implementation of Action Plans (APs) generated from Audit Observations and CAPA Investigations.
-Effective Monitoring check of Action Plans including the report writing.
-Created awareness training items as part of Investigations/Action Plans (for ComplianceWire, a training management e-system).
-Management of external storage/archive project with Merak for archiving/storing quality records and retain samples per Johnson and Johnson Enterprise Retention Schedule (ERS).
profile_positions.title: Senior Quality Assurance Engineer

profile_positions.description:
Key responsibilities:
	Initiate the Deviation in the Global TrackWise (GTW) system.
	Present the Deviation(s) in the Deviation Initial Assessment (DIA) Board.
	Conduct the investigations as a lead investigator.
	Write the comprehensive investigation report.
	Formulate CAPAs in GTW based on the root cause(s).
	Write the Trend/Summary Reports of OOS/OOT.
	Periodic revision of SOPs.
profile_positions.title: Investigator

profile_positions.description:
	Execution of QMS (Quality Management System) and IPQA (In-Process Quality Assurance) activities of different pharmaceutical dosage forms (Tablets, Capsules, Powder for Suspension, Multiple Unit Pellets System-MUPS) to ensure Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP).
	Review of executed Batch Documents (BMR, BPR, Protocols, QC tests report, etc.)
	Documentation Control and Management (Archival, distribution, and retrieval)
	Issuance of BMR, BPR, Protocols, Status Label, Logbook/Register as per SOPs.
	Review and approval of BMR, BPR, PPS, PV Protocol, SOP, EOP, ECP, QC Specification and Test Method as authorized deputy/nominee of Manager, QA.
	Investigation of quality incident (QIR)/Deviation as investigation team leader.
	Handling of OOS/OOT, QIR/Deviation, CAPAs, Quality Risk Management and Change Control (CCR & CDR).
	Took part in Process Validation (PV) activities of different products.
	Conduction of GMP training including EHS system and Orientation Training of employees and Records keeping, Self-inspection/Internal Audit.
	Ensure timely release of the products (Finished Goods) through SAP/ERP system.
	Regulatory audit activities: WHO, TFDA, Sri-Lankan National Drug Authority, MCC, DGDA Bangladesh.
	Vendor Qualification audit in API manufacturing plants as per ICH Guidelines.
	Interaction and collaboration with Production, R & D, Engineering, QA/QC, PPIC (Warehouse) & Regulatory Affairs for production support and quality issue.
profile_positions.title: Senior Executive, Quality Assurance, Formulations Unit-5.

profile_positions.description:
	Supervision, execution, and coordination of analytical activities of different pharmaceutical dosage forms (Injectables, Tablets, Capsules & Powder for Suspensions).
	The operation, cleaning, and basic troubleshooting of HPLC, IR, KFT, Dissolution Tester, and other QC analytical instruments.
	Preparation and review of SOP, EOP, ECP, QC Specification, and Test Method as per regulatory guidelines (ICH, WHO, UK-MHRA, EMA, US-FDA, BP, USP, EP, etc).
	Review of analytical documents of Raw materials and finished products.
	Handling of OOS/OOT, CAPAs, CCR, and other investigations as required.
	Active participation in Process Validation (PV) of products, including sampling.
	Ensure laboratory safety through training and supervision.
	URS preparation and took part in IQ, OQ, PQ of machines/equipment.
	Development of skills (e.g. Operation and cleaning of HPLC, IR, GC, Dissolution Tester, etc.) of newly joined and other junior colleagues.
	Regulatory audit activities: TFDA, DGDA Bangladesh, Kenya, etc.
profile_positions.title: Senior Executive, Quality Assurance (Analytical Wing), Cephalosporins Unit.

profile_positions.description:
	Execution and coordination of laboratory analysis of different pharmaceutical dosage forms (Injectable, Tablet, Capsule & Powder for Suspension).
	Operation and cleaning of sophisticated analytical instruments, for example, HPLC, IR, UV-Visible Spectrophotometer, Dissolution Tester, Micro-balance, Potentiometric Titrator, etc.
	Preparation of SOP, EOP, ECP, QC Specification, and Test Method as per regulatory agency & guidelines (ICH, UK-MHRA, US-FDA, BP, USP, JP, etc). 
	Review of analytical reports of raw materials and finished products.
	Handling of OOS/OOT results, laboratory incidents, change control request (CCR), and implementation of CAPAs.
	Regulatory audit activities: TGA-Australia, UK-MHRA, Uganda, and DGDA Bangladesh.
profile_positions.title: Executive, Quality Assurance (Analytical Wing), Cephalosporins Unit.
